subject: libvirt: Add a default VirtIO-RNG device to guests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-11-08 16:27:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9a2ba75c07af6f006ae99f38295c21fc6cc51939', 'message': '[WIP] libvirt: Add a default Virtio RNG device to guests

Looking at the Nova Git history, back in Jan-2014, when configuring RNG
devices was introduced (in commit: b94550f -- "libvirt: configuration
element for a random number generator device"), Nova _did_ have a
default of RNG device (which used its entropy source as '/dev/random').

However, it was immediately removed (in commit: 605677c -- "libvirt:
remove explicit /dev/random rng default"), with this 'rationale':

    "libvirt (or rather qemu) will default to /dev/random if no rng device
    path is specified [...]

    "It's preferable for us to not duplicate this default to allow for a
    future where libvirt or the hypervisor needs to make more intelligent
    decisions about the default device to use."

The above reasoning doesn't quite hold up:

(a) libvirt does not make "policy" decisions, such as choosing an
    entropy source (or any other such decisions).  Therefore Nova, as a
    management application, should take the decision here.

(b) When QEMU exposes a Virtio-RNG device to the guest, that device
    needs a source of entropy; and QEMU by default uses the legacy and
    problematic `/dev/random` as the source  instead of the preferred
    `/dev/urandom`.  So QEMU's default for Virtio-RNG devices is not
    sufficient, and Nova should not rely on it.

    I raised the topic on 'qemu-devel' list to consider changing
    default:
    https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2018-09/msg02724.html
    ("[RFC] Virtio RNG: Consider changing the default entropy source to
    /dev/urandom?")

Therefore make Nova configure a Virtio-RNG device for guests by default.
And use `/dev/urandom` as the default entropy source.  This will also
work for Windows guests, when using Virtio-Win drivers[*] on the Linux
host.

[*]
https://docs.pagure.org/docs-fedora/create-windows-vms-using-virtio.html

Closes-Bug: #1789868

Change-Id: I28e66c9640c38d23b8c0dbd0b05f5260bfcf6d30
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-11-15 22:17:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/8bca3a37b73e84b9411d301afd154ed3ad3989ee', 'message': '[WIP] libvirt: Add a default Virtio RNG device to guests

Looking at the Nova Git history, back in Jan-2014, when configuring RNG
devices was introduced (in commit: b94550f -- "libvirt: configuration
element for a random number generator device"), Nova _did_ have a
default of RNG device (which used its entropy source as '/dev/random').

However, it was immediately removed (in commit: 605677c -- "libvirt:
remove explicit /dev/random rng default"), with this 'rationale':

    "libvirt (or rather qemu) will default to /dev/random if no rng device
    path is specified [...]

    "It's preferable for us to not duplicate this default to allow for a
    future where libvirt or the hypervisor needs to make more intelligent
    decisions about the default device to use."

The above reasoning doesn't quite hold up:

(a) libvirt does not make "policy" decisions, such as choosing an
    entropy source (or any other such decisions).  Therefore Nova, as a
    management application, should take the decision here.

(b) When QEMU exposes a Virtio-RNG device to the guest, that device
    needs a source of entropy; and QEMU by default uses the legacy and
    problematic `/dev/random` as the source  instead of the preferred
    `/dev/urandom`.  So QEMU's default for Virtio-RNG devices is not
    sufficient, and Nova should not rely on it.

    I raised the topic on 'qemu-devel' list to consider changing
    default:
    https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2018-09/msg02724.html
    ("[RFC] Virtio RNG: Consider changing the default entropy source to
    /dev/urandom?")

Therefore make Nova configure a Virtio-RNG device for guests by default.
And use `/dev/urandom` as the default entropy source.  This will also
work for Windows guests, when using Virtio-Win drivers[*] on the Linux
host.

[*]
https://docs.pagure.org/docs-fedora/create-windows-vms-using-virtio.html

Closes-Bug: #1789868

'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2018-11-15 23:14:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/029f2a55ed7bd930266d9c4238720b5909492685', 'message': '[WIP] libvirt: Add a default Virtio RNG device to guests

Looking at the Nova Git history, back in Jan-2014, when configuring RNG
devices was introduced (in commit: b94550f -- "libvirt: configuration
element for a random number generator device"), Nova _did_ have a
default of RNG device (which used its entropy source as '/dev/random').

However, it was immediately removed (in commit: 605677c -- "libvirt:
remove explicit /dev/random rng default"), with this 'rationale':

    "libvirt (or rather qemu) will default to /dev/random if no rng device
    path is specified [...]

    "It's preferable for us to not duplicate this default to allow for a
    future where libvirt or the hypervisor needs to make more intelligent
    decisions about the default device to use."

The above reasoning doesn't quite hold up:

(a) libvirt does not make "policy" decisions, such as choosing an
    entropy source (or any other such decisions).  Therefore Nova, as a
    management application, should take the decision here.

(b) When QEMU exposes a Virtio-RNG device to the guest, that device
    needs a source of entropy; and QEMU by default uses the legacy and
    problematic `/dev/random` as the source  instead of the preferred
    `/dev/urandom`.  So QEMU's default for Virtio-RNG devices is not
    sufficient, and Nova should not rely on it.

    I raised the topic on 'qemu-devel' list to consider changing
    default:
    https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2018-09/msg02724.html
    ("[RFC] Virtio RNG: Consider changing the default entropy source to
    /dev/urandom?")

Therefore make Nova configure a Virtio-RNG device for guests by default.
And use `/dev/urandom` as the default entropy source.  This will also
work for Windows guests, when using Virtio-Win drivers[*] on the Linux
host.

[*]
https://docs.pagure.org/docs-fedora/create-windows-vms-using-virtio.html

Closes-Bug: #1789868

Change-Id: I28e66c9640c38d23b8c0dbd0b05f5260bfcf6d30
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

'}, {'number': 11, 'created': '2020-01-20 14:08:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9f5d6e64bd1e474a518d9c21328ade85810b04a7', 'message': 'libvirt: Add a default VirtIO-RNG device to guests

tl;dr: This is to ensure guests are not starved to entropy during boot
       time.

Looking at the Nova Git history, back in Jan-2014, when configuring RNG
devices was introduced (in commit: b94550f -- "libvirt: configuration
element for a random number generator device"), Nova _did_ have a
default of RNG device (which used its entropy source as '/dev/random').

However, it was immediately removed (in commit: 605677c -- "libvirt:
remove explicit /dev/random rng default"), with this 'rationale':

    "libvirt (or rather qemu) will default to /dev/random if no rng device
    path is specified [...]

    "It's preferable for us to not duplicate this default to allow for a
    future where libvirt or the hypervisor needs to make more intelligent
    decisions about the default device to use."

The above reasoning doesn't quite hold up:

(a) libvirt does not make "policy" decisions, such as choosing an
    entropy source (or any other such).  Therefore Nova, as a management
    application, should make the decision here.

(b) More importantly, when QEMU exposes a VirtIO-RNG device to the
    guest, that device needs a source of entropy; and QEMU by default
    uses the legacy and problematic `/dev/random` as the source 
    instead of the preferred `/dev/urandom`.  So QEMU's default for
    VirtIO-RNG devices is not sufficient, and Nova should not rely on
    it.

    I raised the topic on 'qemu-devel' list to consider changing QEMU's
    default:
    https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2018-09/msg02724.html
    ("[RFC] Virtio RNG: Consider changing the default entropy source to
    /dev/urandom?")

Therefore make Nova configure a VirtIO-RNG device by default for guests.
And use `/dev/urandom` as the default entropy source.  This will also
work for Windows guests, when using VirtIO-Win drivers[*] on the Linux
host.

[*]
https://docs.pagure.org/docs-fedora/create-windows-vms-using-virtio.html

Closes-Bug: #1789868

Change-Id: I28e66c9640c38d23b8c0dbd0b05f5260bfcf6d30
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2020-01-20 15:21:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/768eca25f039b4341b2d0aa7793fb6e39313b2cb', 'message': 'libvirt: Add a default VirtIO-RNG device to guests

tl;dr: We're adding a default VirtIO-RNG device to ensure guests are
       not starved of entropy (and thus not hang) during boot time.

Background
----------

Looking at the Nova Git history, Nova commit b94550f419 (libvirt:
configuration element for a random number generator device, 2014-01-16)
_did_ add a default of RNG device (but with its entropy source to the
undesirable '/dev/random').  However, the default RNG device was
immediately removed in another commit (605677c -- "libvirt: remove
explicit /dev/random rng default"), with this 'rationale':

    "libvirt (or rather qemu) will default to /dev/random if no rng device
    path is specified [...]

    "It's preferable for us to not duplicate this default to allow for a
    future where libvirt or the hypervisor needs to make more intelligent
    decisions about the default device to use."

The above reasoning doesn't hold up:

(a) libvirt does not make "policy" decisions, such as choosing an
    entropy source (or any other such).  Therefore Nova, as a management
    application, should make the decision here.

(b) More importantly, when QEMU exposes a VirtIO-RNG device to the
    guest, that device needs a source of entropy; and QEMU by default
    uses the legacy and problematic `/dev/random` as the source 
    instead of the preferred `/dev/urandom`.  So QEMU's default for
    VirtIO-RNG devices is not sufficient, and Nova should not rely on
    it.  (Discussion[+] on 'qemu-devel' list to consider changing QEMU's
    default:

Therefore, make Nova configure a VirtIO-RNG device by default for
guests.  (Which will be using `/dev/urandom` as the default entropy
source.)  This will also work for Windows guests, when using VirtIO-Win
drivers[*] on the Linux host.

[*] https://docs.pagure.org/docs-fedora/create-windows-vms-using-virtio.html
[+] https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2018-09/msg02724.html
    -- "[RFC] Virtio RNG: Consider changing the default entropy source to
    /dev/urandom?"

Closes-Bug: #1789868

Change-Id: I28e66c9640c38d23b8c0dbd0b05f5260bfcf6d30
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}, {'number': 13, 'created': '2020-01-21 14:56:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/10cdb63d497d1d46d09544f4c43f672d1d308f26', 'message': 'libvirt: Add a default VirtIO-RNG device to guests

tl;dr: We're adding the default VirtIO-RNG device to ensure guests are
       not starved of entropy (and thus not hang) during boot time.

Background
----------

From Nova Git history, commit b94550f419 ("libvirt: configuration
element for a random number generator device") _did_ add a default RNG
device (but with its entropy source to the undesirable '/dev/random').
However, the default RNG device was immediately removed in another
commit (605677c -- "libvirt: remove explicit /dev/random rng default"),
with this 'rationale':

    libvirt (or rather qemu) will default to /dev/random if no rng device
    path is specified [...]

    It's preferable for us to not duplicate this default to allow for a
    future where libvirt or the hypervisor needs to make more intelligent
    decisions about the default device to use.

The above reasoning doesn't hold up:

(a) libvirt does not make "policy" decisions, such as choosing an
    entropy source (or any other such).  Therefore Nova, as a management
    application, should make the decision here.

(b) More importantly, when QEMU exposes a VirtIO-RNG device to the
    guest, that device needs a source of entropy; and QEMU by default
    uses the legacy and problematic `/dev/random` as the source 
    instead of the preferred `/dev/urandom`.  So QEMU's default for
    VirtIO-RNG devices is not sufficient, and Nova should not rely on
    it.  (Discussion[+] on 'qemu-devel' list to consider changing QEMU's
    default.)

                    - - -

Make Nova configure a VirtIO-RNG device by default for guests.  (Which
will be using `/dev/urandom` as the default entropy source.)  This will
also work for Windows guests, when using VirtIO-Win drivers[*] on the
Linux host.

[*] https://docs.pagure.org/docs-fedora/create-windows-vms-using-virtio.html
[+] https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2018-09/msg02724.html
    -- "[RFC] Virtio RNG: Consider changing the default entropy source to
    /dev/urandom?"

Closes-Bug: #1789868

Change-Id: I28e66c9640c38d23b8c0dbd0b05f5260bfcf6d30
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}, {'number': 14, 'created': '2020-01-21 16:35:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/37d594c80f0f07eee694fc96e880586edb1150b5', 'message': 'libvirt: Add a default VirtIO-RNG device to guests

tl;dr: We're adding the default VirtIO-RNG device to ensure guests are
       not starved of entropy (and thus not hang) during boot time.

Background
----------

From Nova Git history, commit b94550f419 ("libvirt: configuration
element for a random number generator device") _did_ add a default RNG
device (but with its entropy source to the undesirable '/dev/random').
However, the default RNG device was immediately removed in another
commit (605677c -- "libvirt: remove explicit /dev/random rng default"),
with this rationale:

    libvirt (or rather qemu) will default to /dev/random if no rng device
    path is specified [...]

    It's preferable for us to not duplicate this default to allow for a
    future where libvirt or the hypervisor needs to make more intelligent
    decisions about the default device to use.

The above reasoning doesn't hold up, because:

(a) libvirt does not make "policy" decisions, such as choosing an
    entropy source (or any other such).  Therefore Nova, as a management
    application, should make the decision here.

(b) More importantly, when QEMU exposes a VirtIO-RNG device to the
    guest, that device needs a source of entropy; and QEMU by default
    uses the legacy and problematic `/dev/random` as the source 
    instead of the preferred `/dev/urandom`.  So QEMU's default for
    VirtIO-RNG devices is not sufficient, and Nova should not rely on
    it.  (Discussion[+] on 'qemu-devel' list to consider changing QEMU's
    default.)

                    * * *

In this patch:

  - Make Nova configure a VirtIO-RNG device by default for guests.
    (Which will be using `/dev/urandom` as the default entropy source.)
    This will also work for Windows guests, when using VirtIO-Win
    drivers[*] on the Linux host.

  - The 'hw_rng_model' image metadata property is now rendered
    (temporarily) useless -- as it's not used anywhere outside the
    _add_rng_device() method.  But we don't want to deprecate it yet, as
    we may extend it (see code comment for details); docucment that.

[*] https://docs.pagure.org/docs-fedora/create-windows-vms-using-virtio.html
[+] https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2018-09/msg02724.html
    -- "[RFC] Virtio RNG: Consider changing the default entropy source to
    /dev/urandom?"

Closes-Bug: #1789868

Change-Id: I28e66c9640c38d23b8c0dbd0b05f5260bfcf6d30
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: Add a default VirtIO-RNG device to guests

tl;dr: We're adding the default VirtIO-RNG device to ensure guests are
       not starved of entropy (and thus not hang) during boot time.

Background
----------

From Nova Git history, commit b94550f419 ("libvirt: configuration
element for a random number generator device") _did_ add a default RNG
device (but with its entropy source to the undesirable '/dev/random').
However, the default RNG device was immediately removed in another
commit (605677c -- "libvirt: remove explicit /dev/random rng default"),
with this rationale:

    libvirt (or rather qemu) will default to /dev/random if no rng device
    path is specified [...]

    It's preferable for us to not duplicate this default to allow for a
    future where libvirt or the hypervisor needs to make more intelligent
    decisions about the default device to use.

The above reasoning doesn't hold up, because:

(a) libvirt does not make "policy" decisions, such as choosing an
    entropy source (or any other such).  Therefore Nova, as a management
    application, should make the decision here.

(b) More importantly, when QEMU exposes a VirtIO-RNG device to the
    guest, that device needs a source of entropy; and QEMU by default
    uses the legacy and problematic `/dev/random` as the source 
    instead of the preferred `/dev/urandom`.  So QEMU's default for
    VirtIO-RNG devices is not sufficient, and Nova should not rely on
    it.  (Discussion[+] on 'qemu-devel' list to consider changing QEMU's
    default.)

                    * * *

In this patch:

  - Make Nova configure a VirtIO-RNG device by default for guests.
    (Which will be using `/dev/urandom` as the default entropy source.)
    This will also work for Windows guests, when using VirtIO-Win
    drivers[*] on the Linux host.

  - The 'hw_rng_model' image metadata property is now rendered
    (temporarily) useless -- as it's not used anywhere outside the
    _add_rng_device() method.  But we don't want to deprecate it yet, as
    we may extend it (see code comment for details); docucment that.

[*] https://docs.pagure.org/docs-fedora/create-windows-vms-using-virtio.html
[+] https://lists.nongnu.org/archive/html/qemu-devel/2018-09/msg02724.html
    -- "[RFC] Virtio RNG: Consider changing the default entropy source to
    /dev/urandom?"

Closes-Bug: #1789868

Change-Id: I28e66c9640c38d23b8c0dbd0b05f5260bfcf6d30
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/03/616603/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add json param to HTTPAction

To simplify work with jsons and to avoid errors with json arrays
we should add support of request's json param alongside the data
param.

Change-Id: Id866ed13764b1d4db75cf1a819b53a7e8955b34a
Signed-off-by: Oleg Ovcharuk <vgvoleg@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/91/702991/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import json as json_lib :param json: (optional) A JSON serializable Python object to send in the body of the HTTP request. json=None, self.body = json_lib.dumps(body) if isinstance(body, dict) else body self.json = json "[url=%s, method=%s, params=%s, body=%s, json=%s," " headers=%s, cookies=%s, auth=%s, timeout=%s," " allow_redirects=%s, proxies=%s, verify=%s]", self.json, json=self.json, return json_lib.dumps(self.params)
deleted_lines: import json self.body = json.dumps(body) if isinstance(body, dict) else body "[url=%s, method=%s, params=%s, body=%s, headers=%s," " cookies=%s, auth=%s, timeout=%s, allow_redirects=%s," " proxies=%s, verify=%s]", return json.dumps(self.params)

commit_message:
Fix restart handlers for polling.yaml changes

Changes to polling.yaml were not triggering restart handlers due to a
missing check on polling_overwriting.changed. This is committed straight
to stable/stein, as stable/train and later have removed this code.

The polling_overwriting variable is also removed from the
ceilometer-notification handler as it doesn't use this file.

Change-Id: I1e665c7b276d9c885881d96315daac4fa78682ce
Closes-Bug: #1860651
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/85/703985/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: or polling_overwriting.changed | bool or polling_overwriting.changed | bool or polling_overwriting.changed | bool
